body_html: @dandelionmane tensor_summary has different interface, taking only the tensor as input, no tag, and thus couldn't take a string tensor as tag. This is probably inline with the new summary interface . I should wait for more unified solution from google and close this?
body_text: @dandelionmane tensor_summary has different interface, taking only the tensor as input, no tag, and thus couldn't take a string tensor as tag. This is probably inline with the new summary interface . I should wait for more unified solution from google and close this?
body: @dandelionmane `tensor_summary` has different interface, taking only the `tensor` as [input](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/ops/logging_ops.cc#L68), no `tag`, and thus couldn't take a string tensor as tag. This is probably inline with the new summary interface . I should wait for more unified solution from google and close this?
